TITLE.P: Provision/Implementation of a Research Management and Collaboration Platform

SHORT_DESCR.P: The University of Southampton has recently been awarded a contract to continue the administration of research funding on behalf of The Department of Health and Social Care. The new contract commences on 1.4.2018 and will run initially for 5 years with an option to extend for a further 4 years. In order to meet the requirements of the new contract the University will be replacing its current Grants Management platform.
The University of Southampton has recently been awarded a contract to continue the administration of research funding on behalf of The Department of Health and Social Care through the NIHR.

The NIHR seeks to improve the health and wealth of the nation through research by providing a health research system in which the NHS supports outstanding individuals working in world-class facilities, conducting leading-edge research focused on the needs of patients and the public.

The new contract commences on 1.4.2018 and will run initially for 5 years with an option to extend for a further 4 years. In order to meet the requirements of the new contract the University will be replacing its current Grants Management platform.

We are seeking an innovative technology partner to deliver a Research Grants Management and Collaboration platform that will support core business processes, facilitate interoperability with partner organisations and 3rd party systems, and aid us in meeting contractual commitments to simplify and expedite the commissioning of research.

The platform must support continuous improvement across the business, enhancing our ability to feedback to contributors while providing internal and external stakeholders with an exceptional user experience.

The solution must contain a robust auditable business process that can be shaped to meet the needs of a range of funding programmes, while remaining flexible so users can determine new pathways based on proportionate risk based decision-making.
The solution must allow us to efficiently and effectively manage:
— Stakeholder communications.
— Meetings (both virtual and physical).
— Reviews (internal and public).
— Documents.
— Workload.
— Information, data and meta data.
The solution must be highly configurable to enable evolving workflows and business processes across a number of functional areas including:
— Identifying and prioritising topics for research.
— Inviting applications for funding and contracting.
— Contract management, financial management and monitoring of ongoing research projects.
— Managing editorial and publishing activities for research projects.
The solution must deliver integrated dashboards reporting and BI facilities.
The Solution must be GDPR compliant and offer full audit capabilities.

This PIN has been issued in order to gauge capability and interest in the market to assist in our decision making. This is not a call for competition. There will be no prejudice to any future procurement procedure by participation in this PIN.

INFO_ADD.P: Potential bidders with the genuine capability, demonstrable experience in provision of business management / workflow systems and the capacity to meet the requirements set out in this PIN should confirm their interest by expressing their interest via the universities tendering portal.

If you are not already registered as a supplier with the In-Tend Portal, you will need to register your company before accessing the Soft Market test stage. Once registered you will need to express an interest in the project, further details will then become available.
To submit your interest on the In-Tend portal.

Please note, to preserve the integrity of the procedure, all queries must be made via In-Tend. We look forward to receiving your response. The Closing Time and Date for receipt of expressions of interest is 12:00 noon 11.5.2018.

The responses to this PIN will be used to assist in the development of the specification of our requirement. There will be no prejudice to any future procurement procedure by participation in this PIN.
The steps we will be taking to during our assessment process and approximate timescales are as follows:
Early Market Engagement – 12th April to – 11th May.
Supplier Day (w/c 23rd April) - please register your interest in attending our Supplier Day on our In-Tend portal. Further details will be sent to you about this event once you have registered.
Reviewing Soft Market Test Responses 15th May – 31st May.
